rows.story_text:
Today I an not going to school.

It is a holiday.

story_text.eng:
Today I an not going to school.

It is a holiday.

annotation_1.eng: What do you think she will do with her day off from school?

annotation_2.eng: Why does she like not going to school?

annotation_3.eng: Do you think she will miss seeing her school friends and teachers?

rows.annotation_1: What do you think she will do with her day off from school?
rows.annotation_2: Why does she like not going to school?
rows.annotation_3: Do you think she will miss seeing her school friends and teachers?

rows.story_text:
Today I am not going to watch TV.

There is no electricity anyway.

story_text.eng:
Today I am not going to watch TV.

There is no electricity anyway.

annotation_1.eng: Why does she decide to not watch TV?

annotation_2.eng: What would you do if you were to plan a special day?

annotation_3.eng: What do you do during times when your electricity is not working? Do you have special activities for such times?

rows.annotation_1: Why does she decide to not watch TV?
rows.annotation_2: What would you do if you were to plan a special day?
rows.annotation_3: What do you do during times when your electricity is not working? Do you have special activities for such times?

rows.story_text:
What am I going to do?

Today I am going to listen to my body!

story_text.eng:
What am I going to do?

Today I am going to listen to my body!

annotation_1.eng: Her hands only have four fingers! Have you seen someone with four fingers on a hand?

annotation_2.eng: It is uncommon, but some people are born with six fingers on a hand. How many more fingers is six fingers than what she has?

annotation_3.eng: Do you think you can buy gloves for someone with six fingers?

rows.annotation_1: Her hands only have four fingers! Have you seen someone with four fingers on a hand?
rows.annotation_2: It is uncommon, but some people are born with six fingers on a hand. How many more fingers is six fingers than what she has?
rows.annotation_3: Do you think you can buy gloves for someone with six fingers?

rows.story_text:
First I have to be very quiet.

So that I can listen to my own body.

story_text.eng:
First I have to be very quiet.

So that I can listen to my own body.

annotation_1.eng: Have you listened to the sounds your body makes? What are some of them?

annotation_2.eng: Have you heard your stomach rumbling, grumbling, or gurgling?

annotation_3.eng: Have you ever run hard and heard your pulse pounding in your ears?

rows.annotation_1: Have you listened to the sounds your body makes? What are some of them?
rows.annotation_2: Have you heard your stomach rumbling, grumbling, or gurgling?
rows.annotation_3: Have you ever run hard and heard your pulse pounding in your ears?

rows.story_text:
Yes, now I can hear my breath.

I breath in and out, in and out.

story_text.eng:
Yes, now I can hear my breath.

I breath in and out, in and out.

annotation_1.eng: If you stop and listen, can you hear yourself breathing?

annotation_2.eng: Do you breathe through your mouth or your nose most of the time?

annotation_3.eng: Watch the time for half a minute and count your breaths. How many were there?

rows.annotation_1: If you stop and listen, can you hear yourself breathing?
rows.annotation_2: Do you breathe through your mouth or your nose most of the time?
rows.annotation_3: Watch the time for half a minute and count your breaths. How many were there?

rows.story_text:
And I can make my breath noisier. 
Ssssssssssss!

And softer.
Mmmmmmmm.

story_text.eng:
And I can make my breath noisier. 
Ssssssssssss!

And softer.
Mmmmmmmm.

annotation_1.eng: She is making her toy fly around by blowing on it very hard. When have you blown hard on something?

annotation_2.eng: Have you blown out candles on a birthday cake or maybe blown on a fire to help it burn?

annotation_3.eng: How old were you at your last birthday?

rows.annotation_1: She is making her toy fly around by blowing on it very hard. When have you blown hard on something?
rows.annotation_2: Have you blown out candles on a birthday cake or maybe blown on a fire to help it burn?
rows.annotation_3: How old were you at your last birthday?

rows.story_text:
Now I can hear my heart beating!

Doodom, doodoom, dooo dooom.

story_text.eng:
Now I can hear my heart beating!

Doodom, doodoom, dooo dooom.

annotation_1.eng: It is not easy to hear your own heart beating. Can you hear yours?

annotation_2.eng: Put your ear on someone's chest so you can hear their heart beating.

annotation_3.eng: Do you think your heart ever stops beating? Most of your muscles can get tired, but your heart muscle never does!

rows.annotation_1: It is not easy to hear your own heart beating. Can you hear yours?
rows.annotation_2: Put your ear on someone's chest so you can hear their heart beating.
rows.annotation_3: Do you think your heart ever stops beating? Most of your muscles can get tired, but your heart muscle never does!

rows.story_text:
Can I make my heart go faster or louder?

Yes, by jumping up and down twenty times.

story_text.eng:
Can I make my heart go faster or louder?

Yes, by jumping up and down twenty times.

annotation_1.eng: Can you count to 20 to count the jumps?

annotation_2.eng: If you can't count to 20, you can count to 10 and then immediately count to 10 again. That will be just the same.

annotation_3.eng: When you run around and start breathing hard, do you sometimes feel your heart beating in your chest?

rows.annotation_1: Can you count to 20 to count the jumps?
rows.annotation_2: If you can't count to 20, you can count to 10 and then immediately count to 10 again. That will be just the same.
rows.annotation_3: When you run around and start breathing hard, do you sometimes feel your heart beating in your chest?

rows.story_text: Now see, my heart is beating faster.

story_text.eng: Now see, my heart is beating faster.

annotation_1.eng: Have you ever seen your own heart beating in your chest? Is it possible to see it?

annotation_2.eng: The storyteller and artist are stretching the truth a bit here. Have you ever stretched the truth a bit to make a story a little more interesting?

annotation_3.eng: Her toy is covering its ears because the heart is beating so loudly. Is it possible to hear someone else's heart from a distance?

rows.annotation_1: Have you ever seen your own heart beating in your chest? Is it possible to see it?
rows.annotation_2: The storyteller and artist are stretching the truth a bit here. Have you ever stretched the truth a bit to make a story a little more interesting?
rows.annotation_3: Her toy is covering its ears because the heart is beating so loudly. Is it possible to hear someone else's heart from a distance?

rows.story_text: If I put my fingers on my wrist, then I can feel my pulse!

story_text.eng: If I put my fingers on my wrist, then I can feel my pulse!

annotation_1.eng: Can you feel your pulse on your wrist? Some people like to feel their pulse on their neck or on their head. Try it!

annotation_2.eng: Count your pulse for ten seconds. Did you get a count between 7 and 20?

annotation_3.eng: Have another person do the same thing and compare the counts you got. Whose count was more and whose was less?

rows.annotation_1: Can you feel your pulse on your wrist? Some people like to feel their pulse on their neck or on their head. Try it!
rows.annotation_2: Count your pulse for ten seconds. Did you get a count between 7 and 20?
rows.annotation_3: Have another person do the same thing and compare the counts you got. Whose count was more and whose was less?

rows.story_text:
I can hear myself laughing.

Haha, haha, haaah, haaa!

story_text.eng:
I can hear myself laughing.

Haha, haha, haaah, haaa!

annotation_1.eng: She is very expressive, so her laughter is probably very loud. Is it possible to laugh softly? Can you do it?

annotation_2.eng: People often like to laugh together. When you laugh, do other people laugh with you?

annotation_3.eng: Even when there is nothing funny happening, sometimes just laughing out loud can make you feel better.

rows.annotation_1: She is very expressive, so her laughter is probably very loud. Is it possible to laugh softly? Can you do it?
rows.annotation_2: People often like to laugh together. When you laugh, do other people laugh with you?
rows.annotation_3: Even when there is nothing funny happening, sometimes just laughing out loud can make you feel better.

rows.story_text: I can hear myself crying. Boohoooo hooo!

story_text.eng: I can hear myself crying. Boohoooo hooo!

annotation_1.eng: Do you think she is really crying, or is she just pretending?

annotation_2.eng: Do you ever pretend to cry so that people will feel sorry for you?

annotation_3.eng: Some people feel much better after they cry. Do you feel better after you cry?

rows.annotation_1: Do you think she is really crying, or is she just pretending?
rows.annotation_2: Do you ever pretend to cry so that people will feel sorry for you?
rows.annotation_3: Some people feel much better after they cry. Do you feel better after you cry?

rows.story_text:
I can hear myself clapping.

Clap, clap, clap.

story_text.eng:
I can hear myself clapping.

Clap, clap, clap.

annotation_1.eng: Make up a pattern using claps and foot stomps on the ground.

annotation_2.eng: Was your pattern complicated, or was it as simple as: clap clap stomp, clap clap stomp?

annotation_3.eng: Dancing is often a pattern of movements with your arms and legs. Do you like to dance?

rows.annotation_1: Make up a pattern using claps and foot stomps on the ground.
rows.annotation_2: Was your pattern complicated, or was it as simple as: clap clap stomp, clap clap stomp?
rows.annotation_3: Dancing is often a pattern of movements with your arms and legs. Do you like to dance?

rows.story_text:
I can hear my stomach rumbling!

Guddu, guddu, guddu.

story_text.eng:
I can hear my stomach rumbling!

Guddu, guddu, guddu.

annotation_1.eng: When your stomach rumbles, what is your body feeling?

annotation_2.eng: Does your stomach ever rumble when it is having trouble digesting something or when you're sick?

annotation_3.eng: Looking at her face, what is she feeling right now?

rows.annotation_1: When your stomach rumbles, what is your body feeling?
rows.annotation_2: Does your stomach ever rumble when it is having trouble digesting something or when you're sick?
rows.annotation_3: Looking at her face, what is she feeling right now?

annotation_1.eng: Have you ever been so hungry you couldn't wait and you had to eat immediately?

annotation_2.eng: Do you think her stomach is really shoving her to get some food?

annotation_3.eng: Each time she bounds forward, she takes two steps. You can count those steps by counting by 2's -- 2, 4, 6, 8, ...

rows.annotation_1: Have you ever been so hungry you couldn't wait and you had to eat immediately?
rows.annotation_2: Do you think her stomach is really shoving her to get some food?
rows.annotation_3: Each time she bounds forward, she takes two steps. You can count those steps by counting by 2's -- 2, 4, 6, 8, ...

rows.story_text:
My nose can smell cakes baking in mother's kitchen.

And now I want to hear my jaws chewing those cakes!

story_text.eng:
My nose can smell cakes baking in mother's kitchen.

And now I want to hear my jaws chewing those cakes!

annotation_1.eng: How many really small cakes do you think she will eat?

annotation_2.eng: What are the most cookies or other snack you've eaten at one time?

annotation_3.eng: This story has talked about a lot of different sounds to hear from your body. How many of them can you remember?

rows.annotation_1: How many really small cakes do you think she will eat?
rows.annotation_2: What are the most cookies or other snack you've eaten at one time?
rows.annotation_3: This story has talked about a lot of different sounds to hear from your body. How many of them can you remember?
